segments.pli: Ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā campāyaṃ viharati gaggarāya pokkharaṇiyā tīre mahatā bhikkhusaṃghena saddhiṃ pañcamattehi bhikkhusatehi sattahi ca upāsakasatehi sattahi ca upāsikāsatehi anekehi ca devatāsahassehi.
segments.en: At one time the Buddha was staying near Campā on the banks of the Gaggarā Lotus Pond, together with a large Saṅgha of around five hundred mendicants, seven hundred male and seven hundred female lay followers, and many thousands of deities.

segments.pli: Tyāssudaṃ bhagavā atirocati vaṇṇena ceva yasasā ca.
segments.en: But the Buddha outshone them all in beauty and glory.

segments.pli: “ayaṃ kho bhagavā campāyaṃ viharati gaggarāya pokkharaṇiyā tīre mahatā bhikkhusaṃghena saddhiṃ pañcamattehi bhikkhusatehi sattahi ca upāsakasatehi sattahi ca upāsikāsatehi anekehi ca devatāsahassehi.
segments.en: “The Buddha is staying near Campā on the banks of the Gaggarā Lotus Pond, together with a large Saṅgha of around five hundred mendicants, seven hundred male and seven hundred female lay followers, and many thousands of deities.

segments.pli: Tyāssudaṃ bhagavā atirocati vaṇṇena ceva yasasā ca.
segments.en: And he outshines them all in beauty and glory.

segments.pli: Yannūnāhaṃ bhagavantaṃ sammukhā sāruppāya gāthāya abhitthaveyyan”ti.
segments.en: Why don’t I extoll him in his presence with fitting verses?”

segments.pli: Atha kho āyasmā vaṅgīso uṭṭhāyāsanā ekaṃsaṃ uttarāsaṅgaṃ karitvā yena bhagavā tenañjaliṃ paṇāmetvā bhagavantaṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: Then Venerable Vaṅgīsa got up from his seat, arranged his robe over one shoulder, raised his joined palms toward the Buddha, and said,
“I feel inspired to speak, Blessed One! I feel inspired to speak, Holy One!”
“Then speak as you feel inspired,” said the Buddha.

segments.pli: Atha kho āyasmā vaṅgīso bhagavantaṃ sammukhā sāruppāya gāthāya abhitthavi:
segments.en: Then Vaṅgīsa extolled the Buddha in his presence with fitting verses:
“Like the moon on a cloudless night,
so too Aṅgīrasa, O great sage,
your glory outshines the entire world.”

sections.title: At one time the Buddha was staying near Campā…

suttaplex.blurb: Vaṅgīsa says the Buddha, like the moon or the sun, outshines the whole world.
